thread.title: Chatham County NC real estate values increase in August
thread.title_full: Chatham County NC real estate values increase in August

author: Jesse Wojdylo, Raleigh Mortgage Industry Examiner
title: Chatham County NC real estate values increase in August
text:
Chatham County NC real estate values increase in August Use your key for the next article July 2015 Chatham County Housing Market Data Photo used with permission from Real Estate Experts 
The Chatham County real estate market has been red hot over the last few months. Chatham County housing market data shows that median home sales prices are up 21.8 percent in July 2015 compared to July 2014. All around, the numbers for home sales are very bullish for Chatham County. What some people may not realize is many addresses in north Chatham County are Chapel Hill addresses. Housing developments like Briar Chapel and Fearrington Village are less than 10 miles from downtown Chapel Hill. 
If a potential home buyer is looking for very attractive NC mortgage interest rates now might be the time to start the process of getting preapproved by a bank or lender. There are a number of local mortgage brokers that will be willing to shop around to help you find low mortgage loan rates in Chapel Hill, Chatham County or Durham. Finding the lowest possible mortgage rates is much easier today than it ever was in the past. There are a number of great websites including Zillow and BankRate that will help buyers and homeowners see what interest rates others are getting at the present time. 
As many people in the Triangle area of North Carolina know, the summer months are hot. The same is true for the housing market. During the summer months, when families are out and about sellers are not willing to budge on their asking price. Some potential home buyers may want to rent an apartment or townhouse for a few months before they decide which home is correct for them. There is a good chance it will end up saving them a significant amount of money down the road. 
When it comes to buying a house or getting an FHA mortgage loan there should never be a rush. There is nothing wrong with renting a place for six to 12 months just to get a feel for the overall housing market in a specific area. It also doesn't hurt to reach out to several real estate agents and mortgage brokers in the local area. They will be able to help you determine what price range is right for you. They will also be able to use their local knowledge to find some of the best prices in the most ideal areas of Chatham County and Chapel Hill.
